alert.note: Alert for Tulare; Tuolumne (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 14 at 4:40AM PDT until further notice by NWS Hanford
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1245 PM PDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central California and northern California, including the following counties, in central California, Fresno, Kern, Kings, Madera, Mariposa, Merced and Tulare. In northern California, Tuolumne. * WHEN...Until 1245 PM PDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 440 AM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fresno, Bakersfield, Visalia, Clovis, Merced, Madera, Tulare, Porterville, Hanford, Delano, Atwater, Yosemite South Entrance, Los Banos, Wasco, Corcoran, Lemoore, Sanger, Reedley, Selma and Dinuba. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
